page.title: 06SURVEY:OCCUPANTS & TRANSPORT
page.content: Most of the households have two occupants, showing that there are not very many families. We think this could be due to transport and shopping difficulties. One third of these couples are retired people. 20 houses have just one occupant. Out of 120 households, 60 have more than one car, 47 have one car only, and 13 have no car at all. Those who do not have their own transport rely on lifts to get to work, shops, doctors etc. Public transport is sparse and not very convenient. There are only two bus services and they only run twice daily. Most houses have two drivers in the family. In only three houses is there no-one able to drive. Of the cars, 78 are English and 67 are foreign.
